# apptrust_bound_package (Resource)

Binds a package version to an AppTrust application. A package version can be bound to only one application.

## Example Usage

```terraform
# Bind a package version to an application.
resource "apptrust_application" "example" {
  application_key  = "my-web-app"
  application_name = "My Web Application"
  project_key      = "my-project"
}

resource "apptrust_bound_package" "example" {
  application_key  = apptrust_application.example.application_key
  package_type     = "maven"
  package_name     = "com.example:my-library"
  package_version  = "1.2.3"
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `application_key` (String) The application key.
- `package_name` (String) Package name.
- `package_type` (String) Package type (e.g. maven, docker, npm, generic).
- `package_version` (String) Package version.

### Read-Only

- `id` (String) Computed ID (application_key:type:name:version).

## Import

Import is supported using the following syntax:

```sh
#!/usr/bin/env bash
# Usage: ./import.sh <application_key> <package_type> <package_name> <package_version>
# Example: ./import.sh my-web-app maven com.example:my-library 1.2.3
# Import ID format: application_key:package_type:package_name:package_version
terraform import apptrust_bound_package.example "${1}:${2}:${3}:${4}"
```
